instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 230mA
threads.message:
Hi,
i have this board, the board work well and shutdown for always.
i see liquid spill on the board, I clean it by cleaner ultrasonic.
the board have 5V with 250mA, I can see in DFU mode but error in restore.
i have all signal SLPSR and awake. PPBUS is OK (12,31V).
I don't know why maybe T2 chip?
thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 230mA
threads.message:
Did you try DFU connecting battery too?
SSD voltages come on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 230mA
threads.message:
Hi,
yes I try with a battery connected.
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 0
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 0
sorry for the slow answer, I haven't time. now I'm ready to find solution of this Mac.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V 230mA
threads.message:
Board can't boot without SSD voltages.
Check diode mode to ground on corresponding power rails.
Also check on the big coils of secondary power supplies.
